div.p: ANTONIO: So, once again, the question we want to answer is, "Are alcohol and drug problems caused by the kind of person I am, or the kind of choices I make?"
ANTONIO: To answer that, let's go back to the formula for lifestyle-related health problems, and look at what research can tell us about each piece of the equation.
ANTONIO: Research allows us to see beyond your experience or my experience, and look at the broad human experience, so we can see what is true for most people.
ANTONIO: Remember the two components of lifestyle-related health problems? First biology sets a trigger level, and then lifestyle choices trigger the problem.

ANTONIO: Research tells us that alcoholism and drug addiction are lifestyle-related health problems. So, we can prevent these problems by using the same type of thinking that works to prevent heart disease.
ANTONIO: Just like with heart disease, for alcoholism and drug addiction there are risks we cannot change—our biology. And, there are risks can change—our choices.
ANTONIO: Together, our biology and choices will determine the outcome.
